intro: Sidalcea virgata, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, legume-like pods that contain seeds. Sidalcea virgata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
